subject: Business
title: When a Startup Stops Being a Startup
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: When a Startup Stops Being a Startup.

hook.text: At what point does a scrappy startup become a real company? It's not about the headcount.

buildup.text: A startup is searching for a business model. A company is executing one.

discovery.text: The transition happens when repeatable revenue channels replace experimental ones.

twist.text: Many founders resist this shift. They loved the chaos phase, not the systems phase.

climax.text: The best companies build systems without killing the innovation mindset that got them there.

punchline.text: A startup finds the model. A company runs it.

quiz.question: What defines the transition from startup to company?
options: Moving from searching for a model to executing a repeatable one
